### POLICY OWNERS' PROTECTION SCHEME
This policy is protected under the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme which is administered by the Singapore Deposit Insurance Corporation (SDIC). Coverage for Your policy is automatic and no further action is required from You. For more information on the types of benefits that are covered under the scheme as well as the limits of coverage, where applicable, please contact HL Assurance Pte. Ltd. or visit the GIA or SDIC websites (www.gia.org.sg or www.sdic.org.sg).

### CARING FOR OUR CUSTOMERS
HL Assurance Pte. Ltd. will make every effort to provide a high level of service expected by all Our policyholders. If on any occasion Our service falls below the standard of Your expectation, the procedure below explains what You can do:
questions: How does the automatic coverage under the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme apply to this policy, and what steps must the policyholder take to benefit from it?
In what ways can a policyholder obtain detailed information about the types of benefits and coverage limits under the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme for this policy?
What role does the Singapore Deposit Insurance Corporation (SDIC) play in protecting this insurance policy, and how does it interact with HL Assurance Pte. Ltd.?
How might the coverage limits under the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme affect claims made by the policyholder, and where can these limits be verified?
What are the implications for a policyholder if HL Assurance Pte. Ltd. fails to meet the expected service standards, and what procedures are in place for addressing such issues?
How does the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme coverage integrate with the overall policy benefits, and are there any exclusions or conditions specific to this protection?
If a policyholder experiences dissatisfaction with HL Assurance Pte. Ltd.'s service, what formal steps should they follow according to the policy text?
How can a policyholder differentiate between the protection offered by the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme and the insurance coverage provided directly by HL Assurance Pte. Ltd.?
What information sources are recommended for policyholders to understand the scope and limits of the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme, and how reliable are these sources?
In what scenarios might the automatic coverage under the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme not apply, and how would a policyholder identify such cases?
How does the existence of the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme influence the policyholder's confidence in the insurance product offered by HL Assurance Pte. Ltd.?
What are the responsibilities of HL Assurance Pte. Ltd. towards policyholders under the 'Caring for Our Customers' section, and how might these responsibilities impact claim handling?
How does the policy ensure that policyholders are informed about their rights and protections under the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme?
What is the significance of the inclusion of website references (www.gia.org.sg and www.sdic.org.sg) in the context of policyholder support and information access?
How might the procedures for addressing service shortfalls by HL Assurance Pte. Ltd. affect the timeline and process of claim resolution?
What distinctions exist between the protection offered by the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme and any statutory or regulatory protections that might apply to the policy?
How does the automatic nature of the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme coverage impact new policyholders who may be unaware of this protection?
What potential limitations or exclusions should policyholders be aware of when relying on the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme for their insurance coverage?
How does the policy text address the communication of service standards and complaint procedures to ensure policyholder awareness and satisfaction?
In what ways might the Policy Owners' Protection Scheme coverage interact with other insurance policies held by the policyholder, particularly in cases of overlapping coverage?
